meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being strong and robust.
meanings.sent1: The sturdiness of the table impressed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The sturdiness of the bridge ensured safe passage for all travelers.
meanings.sent3: The sturdiness of the toy castle made it the envy of all the other children.
meanings.sent4: Her determination had the sturdiness of a mighty oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The sturdiness of the old tree stump reminded him of his grandfather's resilience.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand pressure or force.
meanings.sent1: The sturdiness of the metal door kept the burglars out.
meanings.sent2: The sturdiness of the rope saved them from falling into the ravine.
meanings.sent3: The sturdiness of the umbrella was tested by the strong winds at the beach.
meanings.sent4: His sturdiness in the face of adversity inspired everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The sturdiness of the dam prevented the floodwaters from causing damage.

meanings.definition: The state of being firmly built or constructed.
meanings.sent1: The sturdiness of the house withstood the storm without any damage.
meanings.sent2: The sturdiness of the wall was evident in its resistance to the impact.
meanings.sent3: The sturdiness of the sandcastle surprised the kids when it didn't collapse.
meanings.sent4: The sturdiness of the foundation ensured the building's stability.
meanings.sent5: The sturdiness of the chair made it a favorite among the family members.
